title: Why can't my phone connect to a router over Wi-Fi?
answer:
<font face="Arial"> </font> 

 <font face="Arial"> 
  </font>
 

 <font face="Arial"> 1.   If the Wi-Fi hotspot is encrypted, check whether the password you entered is correct. Note that the password is case-sensitive. </font> 

 <font face="Arial"> 
  </font>
 

 <font face="Arial"> 2. Check whether the Wi-Fi hotspot name or password has changed. If so, obtain the new information and try again. </font> 

 <font face="Arial"> 
  </font>
 

 <font face="Arial"> 3. Make sure you are within the working range of the Wi-Fi hotspot; otherwise the Wi-Fi connection will automatically disconnect. </font> 

 <font face="Arial"> 
  </font>
 

 <font face="Arial"> 4.   The number of connected devices may have reached the Wi-Fi hotspot's limit. Try connecting to another available network. </font> 

 <font face="Arial"> 
  </font>
 

 <font face="Arial"> 5.   If your phone can't connect to the Wi-Fi hotspot and keeps obtaining an IP address, set a static IP address for it as follows: </font> 

 <font face="Arial"> 
  </font>
 

 <font face="Arial"> For an encrypted Wi-Fi hotspot, touch the hotspot name on the Wi-Fi settings screen. </font> 

 <font face="Arial"> 
  </font>
 

 <font face="Arial"> In the displayed dialog box, select   ** Show advanced options ** . Under   ** IP settings ** , touch the drop-down list box and select   ** Static ** . Then enter the IP address and domain name. Enter the password and touch   ** Connect ** </font> <font face="Arial"> . </font>   

 ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20151019112729945001.png)   

 <font face="Arial">For an open Wi-Fi hotspot, on the Wi-Fi settings screen, touch and hold the hotspot name. In the displayed option menu, select **Modify network **. In the displayed dialog box, select **Show advanced options **. Under **IP settings **, touch the drop-down list box and select **Static **. Then enter the IP address and domain name. After a connection is set up, a Wi-Fi icon will be displayed on the status bar. </font> 

 ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20151019112801561001.png) ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20151019112811921001.png) 

 <font face="Arial"> 1.   Check whether the MAC address filtering is enabled on your wireless router. If yes, phones not in the list can't connect to the Wi-Fi hotspot. For details about configuring the router, see the router User Guide. </font> <font face="Arial"> </font> 

 <font face="Arial"> 
  </font>
 

 <font face="Arial"> 2.    To connect to some public Wi-Fi hotspots, you may need to log in to a web page for registration. For details, contact the Wi-Fi hotspot provider. </font> 

 <font face="Arial"> 
  </font>
 

 <font face="Arial"> </font> <font face="Arial"> If the problem persists, restart the Wi-Fi on your phone or restart the Wi-Fi hotspot device. </font>
